A torque wrench is a tool that ensures nuts or bolts are tightened to the required amount.
A mechanic sets the torque wrench to produce a moment of \(50 \text{Nm}\).
The torque wrench has a length from the centre of the bolt to the handle of 600 mm.
What is the smallest force the mechanic needs to apply to tighten the bolt correctly?
\(W = d \div F\) \(\quad B \quad W = d + F\) \(\quad C \quad W = F \div d\) \(\quad D \quad W = F \times d\)
The work done \(W\) by a force is related to the magnitude \(F\) of the force and the distance \(d\) moved in the direction of the force.
Which equation for \(W\) is correct?

Particles in a gas are further apart than particles in a liquid.
11 Gases can be compressed, but liquids cannot be compressed.
Which statement explains this difference?
Each particle in a gas is more compressible than each particle in a liquid.
A scientist heats a solid substance until it turns into a liquid, and then into a gas.
Which row describes the two changes of state of the substance as it is heated?
A fixed mass of gas at a constant temperature is trapped in a cylinder which has a movable piston.

table.html:
pressureexplanation
Adecreasesgas particles collide with the cylinder at a lower speed
Bdecreasesgas particles collide with the cylinder less frequently
Cincreasesgas particles collide with the cylinder at a higher speed
Dincreasesgas particles collide with the cylinder more frequently
